name: Appointment Information - General Resource
description: The AIG segment contains information about various kinds of resources (other than personnel, location, or auxiliary personnel) that can be scheduled for appointments. These might include equipment, instruments, supplies, or other general resources needed for healthcare appointments and procedures.

cardinality.note: Multiple AIG segments can be used to specify different general resources for the same appointment

AIG.1.name: Set ID - AIG
AIG.1.description: This field contains the number that identifies this transaction. For the first occurrence of the segment, the sequence number shall be one, for the second occurrence, the sequence number shall be two, etc.
AIG.1.generationHint: Sequential number starting at 1 for each general resource in the appointment

AIG.2.name: Segment Action Code
AIG.2.description: This field indicates the action to be taken when processing this segment. It allows applications to process the segment appropriately.
AIG.2.generationHint: A for new resources, U for updates, D for cancellations

AIG.3.name: Resource ID
AIG.3.description: This field contains a unique identifier for the general resource. This should be a system-specific identifier that uniquely identifies the resource within the scheduling system.
AIG.3.generationHint: Use facility-specific equipment identifiers with descriptive names

AIG.4.name: Resource Type
AIG.4.description: This field categorizes the type of general resource being scheduled. This helps in resource management and scheduling optimization.
AIG.4.generationHint: EQUIP most common (60%), DEVICE (20%), TRANSPORT (10%), SUPPLY (10%)

AIG.5.name: Resource Group
AIG.5.description: This field identifies a group or category that the resource belongs to. This allows for grouped scheduling and resource management.
AIG.5.generationHint: Group resources by department or function for easier scheduling management

AIG.6.name: Resource Quantity
AIG.6.description: This field indicates how many of this resource are needed for the appointment. Default is 1 if not specified.
AIG.6.generationHint: Usually 1, but can be higher for supplies or multiple identical equipment

AIG.7.name: Resource Quantity Units
AIG.7.description: This field specifies the units for the resource quantity (e.g., each, box, set, etc.).
AIG.7.generationHint: EA (each) is most common for individual equipment pieces

AIG.8.name: Start Date/Time
AIG.8.description: This field contains the start date and time that this resource is requested for the appointment.
AIG.8.generationHint: Should match or be within the overall appointment timeframe

AIG.9.name: Start Date/Time Offset
AIG.9.description: This field contains the number of units that the start date/time may be moved without affecting the schedule.
AIG.9.generationHint: Flexibility window in minutes: 0 (exact), 15, 30, 60 for flexible scheduling

AIG.10.name: Start Date/Time Offset Units
AIG.10.description: This field contains the units of time for the start date/time offset.
AIG.10.generationHint: MIN most common for short flexibility windows

AIG.11.name: Duration
AIG.11.description: This field contains the duration that this resource is requested for the appointment.
AIG.11.generationHint: Duration in specified units: 30, 60, 90, 120 (minutes) for typical appointments

AIG.12.name: Duration Units
AIG.12.description: This field contains the units of time for the duration.
AIG.12.generationHint: MIN for short procedures, H for longer procedures or equipment use

AIG.13.name: Allow Substitution Code
AIG.13.description: This field indicates whether substitution of this resource with an equivalent resource is allowed.
AIG.13.generationHint: Y for flexible scheduling, N for specific equipment requirements

AIG.14.name: Filler Status Code
AIG.14.description: This field describes the status of the appointment as maintained by the filler application.
AIG.14.generationHint: PENDING for new requests, BOOKED for confirmed resources

notes: AIG segments are essential for comprehensive appointment resource management
Resource ID should be unique within the facility's equipment inventory system
Allow substitution codes enable flexible scheduling while respecting specific requirements
Duration and timing fields ensure proper resource allocation and availability
Status codes track resource utilization throughout the appointment lifecycle
Multiple AIG segments can specify different resources for complex procedures

dataConsistency.timingAlignment: AIG.8 should align with overall appointment schedule
dataConsistency.durationUnits: AIG.11 and AIG.12 must be specified together
dataConsistency.quantityUnits: AIG.6 and AIG.7 should be used together when quantity > 1
dataConsistency.offsetUnits: AIG.9 and AIG.10 must be paired when offset is specified

businessRules.resourceAvailability: Resources must be available during requested timeframe
businessRules.substitutionLogic: Substitute resources must be functionally equivalent
businessRules.statusProgression: Status should follow logical appointment workflow

messageFlow.workflow: Usually accompanies SCH segment and other appointment-related segments
